question: Which two nations share the location of "Mount Richard-Molard"?
explanation: Cote d'Ivoire and Guinea of West Africa share the location of Mount Richard-Molard. This mountain is also known as Mount Nimba, located in Nimba Mountain Range. It is a part of the Guinea Highlands, which also shares its location with Liberia. This mountain is rich in iron ore and cobalt. It lies within Mount Nimba Strict Nature Reserve.
